turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Not bad.  Briliiant, actually.  You come unarmed, and alone.  Cause your army's been growing underground for what? 100 years? 150?

turns.speaker: YAZ
turns.text: Give or take.  It was right around your civil war, I think, when I was here last.  We were waiting till your planet was warm enough.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Goodwill...

turns.speaker: YAZ
turns.text: Most entirely.  Earth has been overrun with an infestation of a species which, in order for the planet to survive, must be exterminated.

turns.speaker: MIKEY
turns.text: Nowhere.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Nowhere, huh? odd you'd get all dressed up like that just to be going nowhere.

turns.speaker: MIKEY
turns.text: Er. well, nowhere special.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I don't believe you, Mikey.  And you know why I don't believe you? Cause last time you said that you and your pals left eight dozen empty beer cans on the other side of the moon.

turns.speaker: MIKEY
turns.text: Yeah, wall, you know, I was just going there... to pick then up.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Oh yeah?  Well if you're suddenly such a good samaritan, why didn't you file a departure report, like you're supposed to?  You know how many rules you've just broken?

turns.speaker: MIKEY
turns.text: I dunno. One?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Try seven.  From unauthorized mobilization to appearing unconcealed before a resident.  You wanna tell me what's going on?  Huh?

turns.speaker: MIKEY
turns.text: It's... coming.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: What are you talking about, it's coming?  What's coming?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: So... now what?  Cattle call again?

turns.speaker: ZED'S VOICE
turns.text: We've got about eight or nine prospects	I want you look--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Yeah, I'll talk to you.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: ... recent landings within a hundred mile radius of Sudbury, Virginia?

turns.speaker: ZED'S VOICE
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Nothing at all?  Now?  Last month? Anything in the last few years?

turns.speaker: ZED'S VOICE
turns.text: Nope.  Nothing at all.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I know what this is.    Zed, you in?

turns.speaker: ZED'S VOICE
turns.text: Yeah, Kay?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Did our friend announce when he's making his speech?

turns.speaker: ZED'S VOICE
turns.text: Noon exactly.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Did he say where?

turns.speaker: ZED'S VOICE
turns.text: Actually, yeah--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Wouldn't happen to be the Lincoln Memorial, would it?

turns.speaker: ZED'S VOICE
turns.text: How'd you know that?  Kay?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Cause I think we're looking at it.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Listen to me. You're holding something very very dangerous. You've just iced 350 of your pals--

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: They're not my pals--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: They're not even gonna be your enemie-a if you don't give that to me really soon.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What if I don't?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: In about 10 seconds they're gonna start losing brain cells at the rate of about a million a minute.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Will it lower the curve?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I don't think it's a tradeoff you really want to make.  Now give it to me-- I can reverse the effects if you give it to me now.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I wanna make a deal.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Found it.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Tell us the truth.  You don't just find these things, at least not in this neighborhood.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I promised I wouldn't tell.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I just wanted to scare em.  So I go in to buy a starter's pistol-- you know, the kind they use at track meets that shoot blanks-- and this guy, he said if I really wanted to mess with with them, he had just the thing...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: This guy.  Where was he?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: We're from Scientific American.  We read about your discovery.  We'd like to take a look.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Scientific American?  Really?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: This it?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Yeah.  Nov I know it looks normal, but watch this.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: I mean, I dunno.  I've seen insects with really great camoflauge ability.  But never like this.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: May I have a look?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: We're with the immigration and Naturalization Service, Intergalactic Bureau.  We monitor all-alien activity in and around Earth and its enveloping atmosphere.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Come again?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Hmnn... wall, it's funny, cause usually I'm not all that attracted to stupid guys, but--

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: But, unfortunately, you're even less attracted to guys you've never seen before.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: We need to talk to you about the alien.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: The what?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Which way?

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Seriously.  I'm not going any further until you tell who you are.

turns.speaker: LAUREL
turns.text: Really nice wheels, by the way.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Wait-- listen--

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: How's Dee?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Fine.  Good.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Jupiter, actually. well, one of the moons.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: So whattya say, kid?  You in or out?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: Kay?  What's your 20?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Highway 119, just west of Smith. Why?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: I need you in Philadelphia.  I got a code 90, in a-high school.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: What the hell is going on?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: He's gone, too.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: What about the other agents?  Ella? Tee?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: Elle's up in Portland-- three of her charges left visibly at a Trailblazers game.  Shots got a lot to mop up.  Tee says his Shanghai quadrasectionals haven't been around since morning.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: Even that little bug you found in Sudbury seems to have taken off.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Jesus, everyone's moving.  Could be an assembly.  Does it look aggressive?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: Hard to tell.  I hope not.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Keep an eye on things there.  We'll see what we can find out at Ernie Goosels.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: They're gone.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Dee?  What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: I'm getting a trajectory...

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: What do we have?  Are we showing anything?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: And they're buying it?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: They went right to the President.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: They went to the President? Directly? THEY WENT OVER OUR HEADS?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: As far as I can tell, the guy's what he says he is - alone, and unarmed.  All he wants is five minutes to introduce himself to the public.

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Where's he making his big speech?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: They haven't announced it yet.  All I know is we're in motion for the most watched media event in history.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: Well, it wasn't in the jar...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Did it leave?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: Actually, I don't know...

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Oh shit!

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Yeah?  What's up?

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: I got a planet check on that bug.  It's from way the hell out in the third belt. it's organic, formed in the same blast that made our solar system.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: And get this: you know how humans evolved from primates?  Well guess what the dominant life form on planet evolved from?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Don't tell me.  Insects.

turns.speaker: ZED
turns.text: How'd you know?

turns.speaker: KAY
turns.text: Just a guess.  But I think found a nest.

turns.speaker: YAZ
turns.text: Now, what are we looking at?  Keys.  Look at them all.  Why do we have them?  Mr. President?

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: Well, uh... so we can got into things, I guess.

turns.speaker: YAZ
turns.text: That's why you have doors, Mr. President.  Keys, however, are to lock the doors.  And locks, as you know, are to keep people out.  Why? Fear.  You humans are afraid.  So you set up boundaries.  Borders. Your car.  Your home.  Your country.  All the while your true enemy could very well be considered already here among you.  Well I am here to let that enemy go.  Because there's a border you didn't even know existed.  It's the border to the Universe.  And unlike your other borders, you humans didn't set this border up to keep other planets from you.  It was set up by others, to keep you away from them.  Until now.  Because I have been sent here to open the door.  To present you, so to speak, with the key to the universe.

turns.speaker: YAZ
turns.text: Why, you might ask?  Because you're ready.  Because you've finally gone as far as you can go without it.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: If I may, sir... what exactly are you offering?

turns.speaker: YAZ
turns.text: A good question.  And a simple answer.  No more hunger.  No more smog. No more overpopulation.  No more war.

turns.speaker: PRESIDENT
turns.text: And I assume you're bringing this to us because we're the most powerful country on the planet...

turns.speaker: YAZ
turns.text: That and, well... I want my friends to see me on CNN.    Okay, I will admit it: ours is an illegal hookup.  We'll gladly pay when you can get your trucks out to install it.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Wally!

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: Can you see?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I'm sorry, but I need your help. You contain information.  I need to know how to get it.  Can you just tell me who Leo Crow is?  Can you tell me if --

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: Is it now?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: Is it now?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: They're inside.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: Take it.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Agatha...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Agatha --

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: Can you see the balloon man?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: Drop some money.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Forget that guy --

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: Do it.  Right here.  On the ground.

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: No.  Follow him.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: He'll turn around.

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: He won't.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Agatha...

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: Wait.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: He's here.

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: Anderton, leave.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I can't.  I have to know.

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: Please --

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I have to find out what happened to my life.  Agatha.  I'm not going to kill the man.  I don't even know him.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Oh, God...

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Every day for the last six years I've thought about only two things. The first was what my son would look like if he were alive today. If I would even recognize him if I saw him on the street.  The second was what I would do to the man who took him.

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: Anderton --

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You were right.  I'm not being set up.

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: Please, I want to go back...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I can't leave.  You said so yourself, there is no Minority Report.  I don't have an alternative future.

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: But you still have a choice.  The others never had a chance to see their future.  You did.

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: Where are we going?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Someplace safe.

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: I have to go back.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: The other two will die without me.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You want to spend the rest of your life in the temple?

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: I always wondered what the world would be like.  But now that I've seen it, I don't need to see any more.  It's all right.  Once I'm in the tank, I won't remember any of this.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Agatha, you're never going back there.

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: I am going back.  I see myself there.

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: Can't you see?  She just wanted her little girl back.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Who wanted her little girl back?

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: The drowning woman.  Anne... But it was too late.  Her little girl was already gone.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: She died?

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: She grew up.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: She's still alive?

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: She's not alive, but she didn't die.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Oh, Jesus...

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: I'm sorry, John, but you have to run again.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: What --

turns.speaker: AGATHA
turns.text: RUN!

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: -- but he didn't.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: Then who was he?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Just some guy... they found.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: Found?  Where?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Somewhere.

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: Think, John.  Why would they set you up?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Because I found out about her...

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: About who?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Anne Lively...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I'm so sorry... I just want him back... I want him back so bad...

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: I know... I do, too...

turns.speaker: LARA
turns.text: John?  What is it?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: How did I not see this?  Agatha, who killed you mother?  Who killed Anne Lively?

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: Don't worry.  I could cut open your chest, sew a dead cat in there and you'd never get an infection.  Not with the spectrum of antibios I'll be shooting into you.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: That's comforting.

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: You do understand I can't just give you new irises.  The scanners will read the scar tissue.  Alarms will go off.  Large men with guns will appear...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Right.  I know --

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: Anesthesia.  Try to relax, John.  I'm saying I'll have to remove your eyes.  Completely.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Yeah --

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: And replace them with new ones.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I know that, but I wanna keep the old ones.

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Because my mother gave them to me. What do you care?  They're no good to you on the secondary market anyway.

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: Whatever you say, John.

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: That's not much.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: It's all I could safely move.

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: Tell you what, since you and I go way back, I'll give you my Old Pal discount.  How's that sound?

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: You don't remember me, do you?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: We know each other?

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: Oh, yes.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: From where?  D.C.?

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: Baltimore.  Eastside.  Solomon P. Eddie M.D.  I was a plastic surgeon.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I put you away --

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: Yes, you did.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You made those tapes...

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: They were performance pieces.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You set your patients on fire!

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: And put them out.  Some not as quickly as others, but let's change the subject, shall we?  The future is much more interesting than the past.  Don't you think?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: So uh, if you were a plastic surgeon before...

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: How can I do what I do now?  Let's just say I spent a lot of time in the prison library.

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: There's food in the refrigerator. Make sure you drink a lot of water.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: How do I find the --

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: Here --

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: It goes from the bathroom to the kitchen.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I can't even stand up --

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: I know you're in a hurry, so I juiced up the nano-reconstruction around your new eyes.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: The nano... what?

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: Organic microbots that reconstruct the nerves and blood vessels. It'll feel like fleas chewing on your eyeballs.  But whatever you do, don't scratch.

turns.speaker: DR. EDDIE
turns.text: I'm setting up a timer.  When it goes off tomorrow, take off your bandages and get the hell out of here.  But not before then, or you'll --

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: -- go blind.  I know.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You the sentry?

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: Yes, sir.  I'm Gideon.  The music relaxes the prisoners.

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: I don't ever see any of you precops down here, I'm not in trouble am I?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: No, you're not in trouble.  I'm interested in a murder.

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: Kill type?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Drowning.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Victim's a white female.

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: This about the Justice Department?  They laid on a tour for tomorrow a.m.  Told me to wear a tie.  You like this one?

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: That's an old one.  One of our first.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: This is the official composite of the three precogs?

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: That's right.  It's a combined data stream based on all three previsions.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Show me just Agatha's data stream.

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: For that, we have to go for a ride.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You the only sentry?

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: I work graveyard, swing and day all by my lonesome.

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: Hence the expression...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: ... Graveyard shift.

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: Not to mention, "Saved by the bell".

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Why's he still a John Doe?  Why wasn't he ever ID's from an EYEscan?

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: On account of those are not his eyes.  He had 'em swapped out to fool the scanners.

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: Huh, we don't seem to have her data.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Try again.

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: No... we have the two previsions from the twins right here, but...  ... I can't pull up any data from the female.  Probably just a glitch.

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: Hey, you wanna know where the word came from, "glitch?"

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Just tell me about the intended victim.  This Anne Lively...

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: Looks like she was a neuroin addict like John Doe here, but I show an address history that includes the Beaton Clinic.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: So she cleaned up.  Where is she now?

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: You're part of my flock now, John. Welcome.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Lara --

turns.speaker: GIDEON
turns.text: It's actually kind of a rush.  They say you get visions; that your life flashes before your eyes.  That all your dreams come true.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Tell me not to worry, John.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Don't worry, Lamar.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: The nation votes this week...

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Which makes this the worst possible time to show that we're only human.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Uh-huh...

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Has the observer from Justice shown up yet?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Hang on, Lamar --

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: And this is exactly the kind of behavior that will give them an excuse to do it.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Lamar, I'm sorry.  I don't know what --

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Don't apologize, John.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: You understand that a week from now people are going to vote on whether or not what we've been doing down here has been some noble-minded enterprise or a chance to change the way this country fights crime.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I understand.  Sir.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: I need you to do two things for me. One, watch Danny Witwer.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: You can let him look around, answer his questions, but watch him.  If there's any problems, make sure we know about it first.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I understand.  What's the other thing?

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Tuck in your shirt.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: And you say the third prevision was, what, a little fuzzy or something?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I'm saying the third prevision wasn't there.  And that's not all. I spent a few hours down there and it turns out there's a dozen more cases with missing previsions.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Danny Witwer is scheduled for a tour of Containment tomorrow --

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: So give him a tour.  He doesn't know enough to ask the right questions.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: If he's looking for a flaw in the system --

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: He's not.  He's looking for a flaw in us, John.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Lara called me.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: She's worried about you.  And, quite frankly, so am I.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I'm fine.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: I hear you've been spending a lot of time in the sprawl.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I go running down there.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: In the middle of the night?

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: What if Danny Witwer came to you right now and insisted on a full chem run?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I'm fine, Lamar.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: You understand, John, that the minute Precrime goes national, they're going to take it away from us.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: We won't let them.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: No?  How's an old man and a cop on the whiff ever going to stop them?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Just so you know, I've overridden the vehicle locator.  I just wanted to talk to you before Justice --

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Justice already knows.  Talk to me, John.  Tell me what's happening?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: This is all Witwer.  He's setting me up.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Stop.  Just wait.  Who's the victim?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Somebody named Leo Crow.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: And who the hell is that?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I have no idea.  I've never heard of him.  But I'm supposed to kill him in less than thirty-six hours.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: All right, John, just take a breath, let's think about this...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I'm out of breath!  I'm a fucking fugitive!

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: Then come to my house.  We'll talk --

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I can't.  They're following me right now.  They'll meet me there. They'll halo me.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: How could Witwer have accessed the case file?

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Can you fake the cerebral output?

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: We're years from that.  John, I'm asking you: please, come in, we'll shut down the system until we get this thing figured out.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You know I can't do that.  You can't do that...  Lamar, I need you to talk to Wally, see if Witwer's gone inside the temple again.  Then ask Jad for any off hour EYEdents into the analytical room --

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: John.  Just tell me, who's Leo Crow?

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: John.  Please.  Listen to me --

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I'm not getting halo'd.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: You can't run --

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Everybody runs.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: John --

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I just wanted to congratulate you. You did it.  You've created a world without murder.  So what if you had to kill someone to do it.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: People want to believe in the system.  That's the beauty of it...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Beauty?  The precogs don't even always agree with each other!

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: No doubt the Precogs have already seen this.

turns.speaker: BURGESS
turns.text: No doubt.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Then go ahead, pull the trigger.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: Seventeen minutes.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Armor up -- sick-sticks and concussion guns -- this is gonna be close.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: Chief, the investigator from the Fed is here.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You're kidding, that's today?

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: I wrote it down in your calendar, then left a message at your house --

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: All I need, some twink from the Fed poking around right now.  Check again with the paper, they had it forwarded.  See if the neighbors know where they went, check all relations --

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: Uh, sir...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Get him some coffee and tell him to wait outside.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: What he's doing now, we call "scrubbing the image", looking for clues as to where the murder's going to happen.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: The brick has been repointed, the glass is original with new glazing bars.  I show composite mouldings with dentils.  Someone took care in the renovation.  Let's find the architect...

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: Victims are pronounced here. Killers here.  We never touch anything.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: I show a cop on horseback.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: Don't run, Chief.  You know we'll catch you.  You trained us.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Everybody runs.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: You don't have to do this, Chief.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: You don't have to chase me, Fletcher.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Okay, Jad, what's coming?

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: Red Ball -- double homicide: one male, one female.  Killer's male, white, 40's.

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: We need confirmation on the time frame.  Location still uncertain. Remote witnesses are hooked in...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Case #1108, previsualized by the Precogs and recorded on holoshpere by Precrime's q-stacks.  My fellow witnesses for case #1108 are Dr. Katherine James and Chief Justice Frank Pollard.

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: We can't grab it...

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Run the subscription list...

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: Got him in the Foxhall.  4421 Gainsborough.

turns.speaker: ANDERTON
turns.text: Send a DCPD blue & white out there, set up a perimeter and tell 'em we're en route.  What's our confirmed time?

turns.speaker: JAD
turns.text: From solar position, Trig & Image confirms it at approximately eight oh-four a.m.
